revised_title: Study of Conjugated Dienes' Vacuum Ultra-Violet Absorption Spectra
tldr: The authors studied the vacuum ultra-violet absorption spectra of conjugated dienes, focusing on butadiene, isoprene, and dimethyl butadiene. They found that the absorption bands of these molecules occur at wavelengths shorter than 2000 Å and observed several Rydberg series converging to specific ionization potentials. The results provide insights into the electronic structures and resonance effects of these molecules.
